div.head: ¶An Acte agaynſt offenders of preachers, and other miniſters of the Churche.
div.p:
FOraſmuche as it is moſt neceſſary in euery chriſtian comon welth to prouide, that tranquillitie and peace may be preſerued and continued amonges the people, and ſpeciallye in holye Churche in the time of diuine ſeruice and adminiſtration of the Sacramentes, and Sacramentalles, as before thys time it hath bene accuſtomed in holy Churche within this realme, and that al thinges beyng contrary therunto, or that are or maye be in diſturbaunce th …
〈…〉
… t be eſchewed and auoyded, and remedy therfore in due tyme prouided, aſwell for the pr •••• ion of the Quenes hyghnes peace, as for an vniuerſall quietnes and ordre to be vſed within this realme.

Be it therfore enacted by the Quene our Soueraygne Lady, the Lordes, ſpirituall and temporall, and commons in this preſent parliament aſſembled, and by the aucthoritie of the ſame, that yf any perſon or perſons of their owne power and aucthoritye, at any time or times, after the .xx. day of December next commyng, do or ſhal willingly, and of purpoſe, by open and ouert worde, facte, acte, or dede, maliciouſly or contemptuouſly moleſte, lette, diſturbe, vexe, or trouble, or by any other vnlawfull wayes, or meanes, diſquiete, or miſuſe any preacher or preachers, that nowe is, or that at anye tyme or tymes hereafter ſhalbe licenſed, allowed, or aucthoriſed to preache by the Quenes hyghnes, or by any Archebiſſhop, or Biſſhop of this realme, or by any other lawful ordinary, or by any of the vniuerſities of Oxforde and Cambrige, or other wiſe lawfullye aucthoriſed or charged by reaſon of his, or their cure, benefice, or other ſpirituall promocion or charge, in anye of his, or their open ſermon, preachyng, or collacion, that he or they ſhall make, declare, preache, or pronounce in any Churche, chappell, Churcheyard, or in any other place or places, vſed, frequented, or appoynted, or that hereafter ſhalbe vſed or appoynted to be preached in.

Or yf any perſon, or perſons after the ſayde .xx. day of December next commynge, ſhall maliciouſly, willingly, or of purpoſe, moleſt, lette, diſturbe, vexe, diſquiete, or otherwiſe trouble anye perſon, vicar, paryſhe prieſt, or curate, or any lawfull prieſt, prepayring, ſaying, doing, ſingyng, miniſtrynge, or celebratyng the Maſſe, or other ſuche diuine ſeruice, Sacramentes, or Sacramentalles, as was mooſte commonly frequented and vſed in the laſte yeare of the raygne of the late Soueraygne Lorde kinge Henry theight, or that at any tyme hereafter ſhalbe allowed, ſet forth, or aucthoriſed by the Quenes Maieſtie.

Or yf any perſon or perſons at any time or times, after the ſayde .xx. daye of December, ſhall contemptuouſly, vnlawfully, or maliciouſly of their owne power or aucthoritie, pul downe, deface ſpoyle, abuſe, breake, or other wiſe vnreuerently handle, or ordre the mooſt bleſſed comfortable &, holy Sacrament of the body and bloude of our Sauiour Ieſus Chriſt, comonly called the Sacrament of the Alter, beyng, or that ſhalbe in any Churche or Chappell, or in anye other decente place, or the pixe or canapie, wherin the ſame Sacrament is or ſhalbe, or vnlawfully, contēptuouſly, or maliciouſly of their owne power and aucthoritie pull downe, deface, ſpoyle, or otherwyſe breake any aulter or aulters, or any crucifixe, or croſſe, that now or hereafter ſhalbe in any churche chappell, or churcheyarde. That then euery ſuche offender and offenders in anye the premiſſes his or their aydour, procuror, or abbettor, aydours, procurours, or abbettours, immediatlye and forthwith after anye of the ſayde Acte or Actes, or other the ſayde miſdemeanours ſo committed, done, or made, or at anye time or times after, ſhalbe apprehended, arreſted, and taken by anye Conſtable or Conſtables, Churchewardeyn, or churchewardeyns of the ſayde paryſhe, towne,
or place, where the ſayde offence or offences ſhalbe ſo committed, made, or done, or by anye other officer or officers, or by anye other perſon or perſons, then beinge preſent at the tyme of the ſayde offence or offences ſo vnlawfully committed, made, or done. Whiche perſon or perſons ſo apprehended, taken, or arreſted with conueniente ſpede, ſhalbe broughte and caryed to anye Iuſtice of peace within the ſayd Shire, or within any Citie, Borowe, Libertie, or Towne corporate, wherin Iuſtices of peace be, where the ſayde offence or offences ſhalbe ſo committed, done, and made, and that the ſayd Iuſtice of peace, vpon due accuſation, thereupon had and made by the apprehendour, or apprehendours, or other perſon or perſons of any of the ſayde perſon or perſons ſo offendynge, forthwith, ſhall committe the ſayde perſon or perſons, ſo apprehended, arreſted, and taken, to ſauffekepyng and cuſtodye, as by the diſcretion of the ſayde Iuſtice ſhalbe thought mooſt mete and conueniente, and that within .vj. dayes nexte and immediatlye after the ſayde accuſation ſo had and made to the ſayde Iuſtice, the ſayde Iuſtice with one other Iuſtice of peace in the ſayde Shire, Citie, Borowe, Libertie, or towne corporate, ſhall diligentlye examine the Acte or Actes, offence or offences aforeſayde. And yf they the ſayde two Iuſtices of peace, ſhall vpon their ſayde examination finde or perceaue the ſayde perſon or perſons ſo accuſed, giltie of any of the ſayde offence or offences, wherof he or they ſhalbe ſo accuſed, and that by two ſufficient wytneſſes, or by his or their owne confeſſion or confeſſions, That then and immediatlye with conueniente ſpede, the ſayde two Iuſtices ſhall committe and awarde the ſayde perſon or perſons ſo accuſed, as is aforeſayd to the gayle of, or for the ſayd ſhire, citie, borowe, libertie, or towne corporate, where the ſayd offence or offences was ſo cōmitted, made, or done, there to remayne without bayle or maine price by the ſpace of thre monethes, then nexte enſuing, and further to the next quarter ſeſſions to be holden within the ſayde ſhire, citie, borowe, libertie, or towne corporate, nexte after thende of the ſayde thre monethes, at which ſayd quarter ſeſſions, the ſayd perſon or perſons, ſo committed to the gayle, as is aforeſayde, vpon his or their reconciliation and repentaunce in that behalfe, before the ſayde iuſtices of peace at the ſayde ſeſſions, ſhalbe deliuered and diſcharged out of priſon and gayle vpon ſufficient ſuertie of his good abearyng and behauoure, to be then & there taken by the ſayd Iuſtices for one hole yeare, then next enſuinge, as by the diſcretion or diſcretions of the ſayde Iuſtices then, and there beyng, or of the more part of them, ſhalbe thought mete and conueniente. And yf the ſayde perſon or perſons ſo in gayle, as is aforeſayde, will not be reconciled and repente at the ſayde quarter ſeſſions, that then the ſayde perſon or perſons immediatlye in time conuenient, ſhalbe further awarded and committed to the ſayde gayle, by the ſayd Iuſtices, or by the more part of them, there to remayne, without bayle or maynepriſe, vntill he or they ſo committed and awarded to gayle, as is aforeſayde, ſhalbe reconciled, and be penitente for hys or their ſayde offence or offences.

And be it further enacted by the auctoritye aforeſayde, that yf anye perſon or perſons, at any time or times, after the ſayde twentye daye of December, of their owne aucthoritye and power, willingly, and vnlawfully do reſkewe anye offender or offenders ſo apprehended, taken, or arreſted, as is aforeſayde, or will diſturbe, hynder, or lette the ſayde offender or offenders, ſo offendyng, as is aforeſayde, to be apprehended, taken, or arreſted, that then euery one of the ſayde reſkewers or diſturbours, ſhall ſuffer lyke impriſonmente, as is aforeſayde, and further ſhall paye forfeyte, and loſe for a fine, for euery of his or their ſayde offences .v. li. to the Quenes Maieſtie her heyres and ſucceſſours.

And be it further enacted, by thauctoritie aforeſayd, that yf any of the offenders aforeſayd be not taken, apprehended, or arreſted immediatly in tyme conueniente, as is aforeſayde, but do eſcape, or go awaye, that then the ſayde eſcape ſhalbe lawfullye preſented before the Iuſtices of
peace in the ſayde Shier, Citie, Borowe, Libertie, or Towne corporate, at the next quarter ſeſſions to be holden, where the ſayd eſcape was made and ſuffred, and that then thinhabitauntes of the paryſhe, where the ſayde eſcape was ſo ſuffred, ſhall forfeyte and loſe to the Quenes Maieſtie her heyres and ſucceſſours, for euery ſuche eſcape. v. li. to be leuied and taken, as other lyke amerciamentes and fines before this time, hath, and bene leauied and taken vpon any village, hundred, or towne, for the eſcape of any murderer, or other felon, for not making purſuite vpon Hue, and crye accordynge to the eſtatute of Wyncheſter, and the eſtatute made and prouided in the thirde yeare of the worthy kyng Henry the ſeuenth.

And be it further enacted by thaucthoritie aforeſayde, that all and ſinguler the Iuſtices of peace, Iuſtices of aſſiſe, Iuſtices of oyer and determiner, & all and ſinguler Maiours, Bayliffes, and Iuſtices of peace, within anye Citie, Borowe, or Towne corporate, in any partes within this realme, within the limittes of their commiſſion or commiſſions, ſhal haue full power and aucthoritie, by vertue of this Acte, after the ſayd .xx. daye of December, to enquire of all and ſinguler the offences and miſdemeanours aforeſayd, and to heare and determine the ſame, and to ſet the fines and amerciamentes of the ſayd offender or offenders, as is afore ſayd.

Prouided alwayes, and be it further enacted by thauctoritie aforeſayd, that this Acte or anye thing therin conteyned, ſhal not in any wiſe extende to abrigate and take away thauctoritie. Iuriſdiccion, power, and punyſhmentes of the eccleſiaſticall lawes, nowe ſtandynge, and remayning in their force, of, or for the puniſhmente of anye the offences and miſdemeanours afore ſayde, but that thauctoritye, power, Iuriſdiccions, and puniſhmentes of the ſayde eccleſiaſtical lawes, of, & for anye of the offences and miſdemeanours aforeſayd, ſhal ſtande in ful power and ſtrength, and to be vſed and exerciſed in all, and in euery thinges, as thoughe his Acte had neuer bene had and made. This preſent Acte or any thyng therin conteyned to the contrary hereof in any wyſe notwithſtandynge.

Prouided alwayes, and be it enacted, that whatſoeuer perſon offendyng in the premiſſes, ſhall for any of the offences afore recited, receaue punyſhment of the ordinarye, hauyng a teſtimoniall therof, vnder the ſayde ordinaries ſeale, ſhall not for the ſame offence, eftſones be conuicted before the Iuſtice, and in likewyſe receauynge for the ſayde offences, puniſhment by the Iuſtice, he ſhall not for the ſame offence eftſones receaue puniſhment of the ordinarye. Anye thynge in this Acte to the contrary notwithſtandynge.
